items.name: SADANLVR
items.description: ADF SAD ambient noise level register.

fields.name: BSMXACTIVE
fields.description: BSMX active flag. This bit is set and cleared by hardware. It is used by the application to check if the BSMX is effectively enabled (active) or not. BSSEL[4:0] can only be updated when BSMXACTIVE is set to 0. This BSMXACTIVE flag cannot go to 0 if DFLT0 is enabled.

fields.name: CCK0EN
fields.description: CCK0 clock enable. This bit is set and reset by software. It is used to control the generation of the bitstream clock on the CCK pin.

fields.name: CCK1EN
fields.description: CCK1 clock enable. This bit is set and reset by software. It is used to control the generation of the bitstream clock on the CCK pin.

fields.name: CKGMOD
fields.description: Clock generator mode. This bit is set and reset by software. It is used to define the way the clock generator is enabled. This bit must not be changed if the filter is enabled (DFTEN = 1).

fields.name: CCK0DIR
fields.description: CCK0 direction. This bit is set and reset by software. It is used to control the direction of the ADF_CCK0 pin.

fields.name: CCK1DIR
fields.description: CCK1 direction. This bit is set and reset by software. It is used to control the direction of the ADF_CCK1 pin.

fields.name: TRGSENS
fields.description: CKGEN trigger sensitivity selection. This bit is set and cleared by software. It is used to select the trigger sensitivity of the trigger signals. This bit is not significant if the CKGMOD = 0.

fields.name: TRGSRC
fields.description: Digital filter trigger signal selection. This bit is set and cleared by software. It is used to select the trigger signal for the digital filter. This bit is not significant if the CKGMOD = 0.

fields.name: CCKDIV
fields.description: Divider to control the CCK clock.

fields.name: PROCDIV
fields.description: Divider to control the serial interface clock.

fields.name: DATSRC
fields.description: Source data for the digital filter.

fields.name: MCICD
fields.description: CIC decimation ratio selection. This bitfield is set and cleared by software.It is used to select the CIC decimation ratio. A decimation ratio smaller than two is not allowed. The decimation ratio is given by (CICDEC+1).

fields.name: SCALE
fields.description: Scaling factor selection. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It is used to select the gain to be applied at CIC output. If the application attempts to write a new gain value while the previous one is not yet applied, this new gain value is ignored. Reading back this bitfield informs the application on the current gain value.

fields.name: DFLTEN
fields.description: DFLT enable. This bit is set and reset by software. It is used to enable the digital filter.

fields.name: DMAEN
fields.description: DMA requests enable. This bit is set and reset by software. It is used to control the generation of DMA request to transfer the processed samples into the memory.

fields.name: NBDIS
fields.description: Number of samples to be discarded.

fields.name: HPFBYP
fields.description: High-pass filter bypass. This bit is set and cleared by software. It is used to bypass the high-pass filter.

fields.name: HPFC
fields.description: High-pass filter cut-off frequency. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. it is used to select the cut-off frequency of the high-pass filter. F PCM represents the sampling frequency at HPF input.

fields.name: SKPDLY
fields.description: Delay to apply to a bitstream. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It defines the number of input samples that are skipped. Skipping is applied immediately after writing to this bitfield, if SKPBF = 0 and DFLTEN = 1. If SKPBF = 1, the value written into the register is ignored by the delay state machine.

fields.name: TRGO
fields.description: Trigger output control Set by software and reset by.

fieldset/SADANLVR.description: ADF SAD ambient noise level register. This bitfield is set by hardware. It contains the latest ambient noise level computed by the SAD. To refresh this bitfield, the SDLVLF flag must be cleared.

fieldset/SADCR.description: ADF Sound activity detector (SAD) control register.

fields.name: SDLVL
fields.description: Short term sound level. This bitfield is set by hardware. It contains the latest sound level computed by the SAD. To refresh this value, SDLVLF must be cleared.

fields.name: STH
fields.description: Manchester symbol threshold/SPI threshold. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It is used for Manchester mode to define the expected symbol threshold levels (seer to Manchester mode for details on computation). In addition this bitfield is used to define the timeout value for the clock absence detection in Normal SPI mode. STH[4:0] values lower than four are invalid.

enum/ACQMOD.description: DFLT trigger mode. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It is used to select the trigger mode of the DFLT0.

enum/BSSEL.description: Bitstream selection. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It is used to select the bitstream to be used by the DFLT0.

enum/CCKDIR.description: CCK1 direction. This bit is set and reset by software. It is used to control the direction of the ADF_CCK1 pin.

enum/CCKDIV.description: Divider to control the CCK clock. This bit is set and reset by software. It is used to control the frequency of the bitstream clock on the CCK pin.

variants.name: DIV2
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 2.

variants.name: DIV3
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 3.

variants.name: DIV4
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 4.

variants.name: DIV5
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 5.

variants.name: DIV6
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 6.

variants.name: DIV7
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 7.

variants.name: DIV8
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 8.

variants.name: DIV9
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 9.

variants.name: DIV10
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 10.

variants.name: DIV11
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 11.

variants.name: DIV12
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 12.

variants.name: DIV13
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 13.

variants.name: DIV14
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 14.

variants.name: DIV15
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 15.

variants.name: DIV16
variants.description: The ADF_CCK clock is adf_proc_ck divided by 16.

enum/CCKEN.description: CCK clock enable. This bit is set and reset by software. It is used to control the generation of the bitstream clock on the CCK pin.

variants.name: Generated
variants.description: Bitstream clock generated on the CCK pin.

enum/CICMOD.description: Select the CIC order. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It is used to select the MCIC order.

variants.name: SINC4
variants.description: MCIC configured in single Sinc4 filter.

variants.name: SINC5
variants.description: MCIC configured in single Sinc5 filter.

enum/CKGMOD.description: Clock generator mode. This bit is set and reset by software. It is used to define the way the clock generator is enabled. This bit must not be changed if the filter is enabled (DFTEN = 1).

variants.name: Immediate
variants.description: The kernel clock is provided to the dividers as soon as CKGDEN is set to 1.

variants.name: Trigger
variants.description: The kernel clock is provided to the dividers when CKGDEN is set to 1 and the trigger condition met.

enum/DATCAP.description: Data capture mode. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It is used to define in which conditions, the samples provided by DLFT0 are stored into the memory.

variants.name: Disabled
variants.description: Samples from DFLT0 not transfered into the memory.

variants.name: OnDetected
variants.description: Samples from DFLT0 transfered into the memory when SAD is in DETECT state.

variants.name: Enabled
variants.description: Samples from DFLT0 transfered into memory when SAD and DFLT0 are enabled.

enum/DATSRC.description: Source data for the digital filter.

variants.name: BSMX
variants.description: Stream coming from the BSMX selected

variants.name: ADCITF1
variants.description: Stream coming from the ADCITF1 selected

variants.name: ADCITF2
variants.description: Stream coming from the ADCITF2 selected

enum/DETCFG.description: Sound trigger event configuration. This bit is set and cleared by software. It is used to define if the sddet_evt event is generated only when the SAD enters to MONITOR state or when the SAD enters or exits the DETECT state.

variants.name: Monitor
variants.description: sddet_evt generated when SAD enters the MONITOR state.

variants.name: Detect
variants.description: sddet_evt generated when SAD enters or exits the DETECT state.

enum/FRSIZE.description: Frame size. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. it is used to define the size of one frame and also to define how many samples are taken into account to compute the short-term signal level.

enum/HGOVR.description: Hangover time window. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It is used to select the hangover time window.

variants.name: Frames 4
variants.description: SAD back to MONITOR state if sound is below threshold for 4 frames.

variants.name: Frames 8
variants.description: SAD back to MONITOR state if sound is below threshold for 4 frames.

variants.name: Frames 16
variants.description: SAD back to MONITOR state if sound is below threshold for 4 frames.

variants.name: Frames 32
variants.description: SAD back to MONITOR state if sound is below threshold for 4 frames.

variants.name: Frames 64
variants.description: SAD back to MONITOR state if sound is below threshold for 4 frames.

variants.name: Frames 128
variants.description: SAD back to MONITOR state if sound is below threshold for 4 frames.

variants.name: Frames 256
variants.description: SAD back to MONITOR state if sound is below threshold for 4 frames.

variants.name: Frames 512
variants.description: SAD back to MONITOR state if sound is below threshold for 4 frames.

enum/HPFC.description: High-pass filter cut-off frequency. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. it is used to select the cut-off frequency of the high-pass filter. F PCM represents the sampling frequency at HPF input.

enum/LFRNB.description: LFRNB. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It is used to define the number of learning frames to perform the first estimate of the noise level.

enum/RSFLTD.description: Reshaper filter decimation ratio. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It is used to select the decimation ratio of the reshaper filter.

enum/RXFIFO.description: RXFIFO threshold selection. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It is used to select the RXFIFO threshold.

variants.name: NotEmpty
variants.description: RXFIFO threshold event generated when the RXFIFO is not empty

variants.name: HalfFull
variants.description: RXFIFO threshold event generated when the RXFIFO is half-full

enum/SADMOD.description: SAD working mode. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It is used to define the way the SAD works

variants.name: ThresholdEstimatedAmbientNoise
variants.description: Threshold value computed according to the estimated ambient noise. The SAD triggers when the sound level (SDLVL) is bigger than the defined threshold. In this mode, the SAD works like a voice activity detector.

variants.name: ThresholdMinimumNoiselevel
variants.description: Threshold value equal to ANMIN[12:0], multiplied by the gain selected by SNTHR[3:0] The SAD triggers when the sound level (SDLVL) is bigger than the defined threshold. In this mode, the SAD works like a sound detector.

variants.name: ThresholdMinimumNoiselevelx4
variants.description: Threshold value given by 4 x ANMIN[12:0]. The SAD triggers when the estimated ambient noise (ANLVL), multiplied by the gain selected by SNTHR[3:0] is bigger than the defined threshold. In this mode, the SAD is working like an ambient noise estimator. Hysteresis function cannot be used in this mode.

enum/SADST.description: SAD state. This bitfield is set and cleared by hardware. It indicates the SAD state and is meaningful only when SADEN = 1.

enum/SCKSRC.description: Serial clock source. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It is used to select the clock source of the serial interface.

enum/SITFMOD.description: Serial interface mode. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It is used to select the serial interface mode.

variants.name: ManchesterFalling
variants.description: Manchester mode rising edge = logic 0, falling edge = logic 1.

variants.name: ManchesterRising
variants.description: Manchester mode rising edge = logic 1, falling edge = logic 0.

enum/SNTHR.description: SNTHR. This bitfield is set and cleared by software. It is used to select the gain to be applied at CIC output. If the application attempts to write a new gain value while the previous one is not yet applied, this new gain value is ignored. Reading back this bitfield informs the application on the current gain value.

variants.name: NOISE PLUS 3_5
variants.description: Threshold is 3.5 dB higher than ANLVL

variants.name: NOISE PLUS 6_0
variants.description: Threshold is 6.0 dB higher than ANLVL

variants.name: NOISE PLUS 9_5
variants.description: Threshold is 9.5 dB higher than ANLVL

variants.name: NOISE PLUS 12
variants.description: Threshold is 12 dB higher than ANLVL

variants.name: NOISE PLUS 15_6
variants.description: Threshold is 15.6 dB higher than ANLVL

variants.name: NOISE PLUS 18
variants.description: Threshold is 18 dB higher than ANLVL

variants.name: NOISE PLUS 21_6
variants.description: Threshold is 21.6 dB higher than ANLVL

variants.name: NOISE PLUS 24_1
variants.description: Threshold is 24.1 dB higher than ANLVL

variants.name: NOISE PLUS 27_6
variants.description: Threshold is 27.6 dB higher than ANLVL

variants.name: NOISE PLUS 30_1
variants.description: Threshold is 30.1 dB higher than ANLVL

enum/TRGSENS.description: CKGEN trigger sensitivity selection. This bit is set and cleared by software. It is used to select the trigger sensitivity of the trigger signals. This bit is not significant if the CKGMOD = 0.

variants.name: RisingEdge
variants.description: A rising edge event triggers the activation of CKGEN dividers.

variants.name: FallingEdge
variants.description: A falling edge even triggers the activation of CKGEN dividers.
